abstract: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the path contains the specified point.
overview:
## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the path’s enclosed area contains the specified point; otherwise, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Discussion

This method checks the point against the path itself and the area it encloses. When determining hits in the enclosed area, this method uses the non-zero winding rule ([doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSNonZeroWindingRule]). It does not take into account the line width used to stroke the path.

# contains(_:)

**Instance Method**

Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the path contains the specified point.

## Declaration

```swift
func contains(_ point: NSPoint) -> Bool
```

## Parameters

- **point**: The point to test against the path, specified in the path object’s coordinate system.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the path’s enclosed area contains the specified point; otherwise, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

## Discussion

This method checks the point against the path itself and the area it encloses. When determining hits in the enclosed area, this method uses the non-zero winding rule ([doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSNonZeroWindingRule]). It does not take into account the line width used to stroke the path.
title: contains(_:)
